Lisa- At Costco, we make every effort to provide a wide variety of products at all of our warehouses, but each of our selected items must demonstrate high enough sales for us to continue to stock it. We also have to take into account whether our suppliers have enough merchandise available and stock accordingly. Nevertheless, Costco takes inventory requests from members very seriously, and we've forwarded your interest in this product to the appropriate department. We also invite you to visit the following link to share feedback with your local Costco directly: https://www.costco.com/WarehouseFeedback.html Thanks for posting! -Bekah

oddly enough, while i agree in theory, I find that synthetic tops work much better with my figure. Cotton tops make me look huge. And I like some stretch in my pants, and I find that adding 5% synthetics make them last so much longer. I get years (usually decades) of wear out of my clothes. I take all used, non-donatable fabrics to H&M for recycling, and in return they give me 15% off (they work well for my kids and basic staples for me). Keeps fabrics out of the landfill.

The chemicals in synthetic fabrics include BPA, PFOA, formaldehyde, and more. They are known to cause cancer, and reproductive issues in both men and women. Other health conditions that these chemicals have been linked to include thyroid dysfunction, asthma, skin irritation, and more.
Keep them. There are other buying options that do not fund discrimination. Costco as a DEI honey pot needs to go.
